etymologies: Old English ongemang (from on ‘in’ + gemang ‘assemblage, mingling’). The -st of amongst represents -s (adverbial genitive) + -t probably by association with superlatives (as in against)

definitions: surrounded by; in the company of

examples.text: wild strawberries hidden among the roots of the trees

definitions: being a member or members of (a larger set)

examples.text: snakes are among the animals most feared by humans
he was among the first 29 students enrolled

definitions: occurring in or practiced by (some members of a community)

examples.text: a drop in tooth decay among children
this pronunciation is not popular among the general public
rooting out abuses among the clergy

definitions: involving most or all members of a group reciprocally

examples.text: members of the government bickered among themselves

shortDefinitions: involving most or all members of group reciprocally

definitions: indicating a division, choice, or differentiation involving three or more participants

examples.text: the king called the three princesses to divide his kingdom among them
choosing a privatization scheme from among five models
